title: Why I Built My Own Blog Platform (And How You Can Too)
content:
# Why I Built My Own Blog Platform (And How You Can Too)

I've always loved writing and building things just for myself. So instead of signing up for Medium or Hashnode, I decided to make my own blogging platform — simple, clean, and fully under my control.

This blog runs on Flask, uses Markdown for writing, and generates an RSS feed. I wanted something that felt like *mine*, from the folder structure to the publish button.

Here’s what I learned while building it:
- Creating a local-first Markdown editor with SimpleMDE is fun and fast.
- JSON storage works great for small projects (no need for a database yet).
- CI/CD makes it feel real — deploying with GitHub Actions taught me more than any tutorial.

I also added features I actually care about:
- Clean timeline
- Dark mode toggle
- Tag filtering
- Edit/Delete without needing an admin panel

Would I recommend it? Definitely. Not just because it’s “cool to build your own” — but because the process teaches you exactly how the web works.

---

###  Tech Stack:
- Flask (Python)
- Markdown + SimpleMDE
- GitHub Actions (CI/CD)
- HTML + CSS (handcrafted)

---

You can find the source code [on my GitHub](https://github.com/asrithcheepurupalli).

If you're curious, just fork it and try it out.
